summary: This bill, the Guaranteeing Reliability through the Interconnection of Dispatchable Power Act (GRID Power Act), mandates the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to reform the process for interconnecting power projects to the electric grid. It directs FERC to initiate a rulemaking to address inefficiencies in processing interconnection requests, prioritizing new dispatchable power projects that enhance grid reliability and resource adequacy. The bill sets deadlines for rulemaking, proposal review, and final regulation promulgation, with periodic reviews to ensure ongoing effectiveness.
